title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: I almost skipped " Frost / Nixon , "

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: and I am glad I didn"t .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: It"s eminently worthwhile , one of the year"s few films that deserves to be seen .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: My reluctance had to do with the expectation that it will offer nothing new to somebody who lived through the Watergate years and saw the Frost interviews ( although remembering surprisingly little of them ) .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: Ron Howard"s film is anything but ho - hum - if anything it"s a bit too gussied up to be exciting .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: There is an element of discernible manipulation of the audience ,

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: but mostly it works , and you don"t long resist it .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: The ( relatively ) unsung hero of the film besides Howard , Frank Langella"s tremendous Nixon , and Michael Sheen"s excellent Frost is the screenwriter : once again Peter Morgan ( of " The Last King of Scotland " and " The Queen " ) engages mind and heart ,
person_name: Peter Morgan, Ron Howard, Frank Langella, Michael Sheen

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: and doesn"t let go .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: Sam Rockwell"s James Reston , Jr. And Oliver Platt"s Bob Zelnick ( Frost"s two collaborators ) are outstanding ,

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: and Kevin Bacon"s Nixon - worshipping Jack Brennan is the actor"s best work in a long time .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: Morgan and Howard manage to make the viewer think constantly of another criminal President without saying or showing anything overt - they just let history , past and present , speak .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: I had a strange , uncomfortable thought watching " Frost / Nixon " : even if some future film " humanizes " ( not excuses ) Bush the way Nixon comes through this one , W. Would still remain a malevolent midget against Nixon"s accomplishments and actual * brain * .

title: 'Frost/Nixon' - not what you think
review: How far we have fallen .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: Dislocation is rarely a pleasant experience ,

title: A unique masterpiece
review: but when the title object of " Howl"s Moving Castle " first comes into view , its visual , historical , stylistic ambiguity is downright thrilling .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: Master animator Hayao Miyazaki ( of " Spirited Away " and " Princess Mononoke " ) once again takes the breath away with his bizarre imagination and richly painted scenes .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: The enormous lumbering Gothic / sci - fi structure looming over the late-19th century Alsatian ( ! ) cityscape reminds one of Hieronymus Bosch , of Pieter Breughel , of Friedensreich Hundertwasser ,
person_name: Hieronymus Bosch, Pieter Breughel, Friedensreich Hundertwasser

title: A unique masterpiece
review: and yet remains resolutely unique - it is Miyazaki , and no one else .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: Neither a Hollywood computer - animated film nor a typical Japanese anime , Miyazaki"s work is a phenomenon onto itself .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: As a movie , " Castle " ( " Hauru no ugoku shiro " ) , at 2 hours " running time , is about a half an hour too long .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: As a work of art , a visual sensation , it"s over much too quickly , although it is guaranteed to continue to run in one"s mind .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: Adopting British author Diana Wynne Jones novel , Miyazaki tells the story of Howl , a terrifying and yet insecure wizard / demon ; young milliner Sophie , who is turned into a 90 - year - old woman by the Witch of the Waste ; Calcifer , a fiery little demon , who powers the castle ; Markl , Howl"s young apprentice ; and the mystical Madame Suliman .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: Heaven forfend that such a work be dubbed ( " Spirited Away " was different - and superior - in the subtitled version ) ,

title: A unique masterpiece
review: but Miyazaki admirers John Lassater and Pete Docter of Pixar have put heart and soul into the English version , and they succeeded .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: The voice talent for " Castle " is extraordinary : Jean Simmons is old Sophie ( the film"s main character ) , Emily Mortimer is the pre - curse Sophie , Laren Bacall makes the evil witch almost lovable , Billy Crystal is Calcifer ( not overdoing it ) ,
person_name: Jean Simmons, Emily Mortimer, Laren Bacall, Billy Crystal

title: A unique masterpiece
review: and Christian Bale is Howl .

title: A unique masterpiece
review: For " Spirited Away " fans , " Castle " is a must ; for those unfamiliar with Miyazaki , this is a splendid introduction to the work of a creative genius .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: First , an easy quiz ( which you"re going to get wrong ): How many wives did King Henry VIII have ? Answer at the end of this article ,

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: but why not try to figure it out before looking ? Oh , too late , you already did ...

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: And now , a question : Did Henry VIII always look like Charles Laughton , with the heft and bulges of the most memorable actor in the role of the monarch ? The truth is that both the king and Laughton looked a lot better when they were young .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: Instead of a fat , dissolute Henry , there was back in the early 16th century a trimmer , more handsome king , who soon ate and married too much .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: That Henry , not the famous picture of him by Holbein , must have looked like Eric Bana .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: And so , in Philippa Gregory"s Hollywood - compliant but terrifically entertaining " The Other Boleyn Girl , " it is Bana - from the non - green scenes of the 2003 " Hulk " - who rules , while the real - life plain - to - ugly Boleyn girls are brought to you by Natalie Portman ( Anne ) and Scarlett Johansson ( Mary ) .
person_name: Philippa Gregory, Eric Bana, Natalie Portman, Scarlett Johansson

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: It is to their credit and , especially , that of director Justin Chadwick that you buy all these prettifications , all or most of author Gregory"s romantic liberties with the story , and enjoy the movie thoroughly .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: Chadwick is new to feature films ,

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: but he has solid credits in TV , especially with the recent magnificent BBC " Bleak House , " as fine a realization of Dickens as you"ll find anywhere .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: And , speaking of the BBC , if you want to see a less " pretty , " more substantial version of Gregory"s novel , dig up the 2003 TV version of " The Other Boleyn Girl , " with Jodhi May and Natascha McElhone ; those two run rings around the smirking Portman and the too - angelic Johansson .
person_name: Jodhi May, Natascha McElhone, Portman, Johansson

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: The exalted Peter Morgan wrote the screenplay - as well as for the superior " The Queen " and " The Last King of Scotland " - and an in - depth research project is just waiting for the right scholar to compare Morgan"s " Boleyn " script with Philippa Lowthorpe"s for the TV version .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: So , with novelist , script writer , director , and a darn fine yarn to begin with , the new film has much going for it .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: The supposedly well - known story of Henry"s marriage to Anne and dalliance with Mary is told well , bringing into focus a great many sub - stories of background machinations by a power - hungry family using the two sisters as bait .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: If at first you must overcome the challenge of seeing Anne Boleyn behind Portman"s glitz and 21st - century " tude , by the time the character reaches the catastrophic comeuppance for her ( and her family"s ) scheming , Portman comes close to the touchstone established by Jodhi May . Quiz answer : Two .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: Surely you think six ,

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: but that"s not right .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: Four of Henry"s marriages were annulled , which means officially they never existed .

title: A Pretty Tudor Thriller
review: Although Gregory"s book doesn"t deal with this tricky question , you can take the information to the bank .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: Woody Allen"s new film " Match Point " has five large themes , three of which are among my principal passions : opera , tennis , London , murder , and a thesis that sheer , dumb luck is not only the origin of life , but also its most decisive element .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: Except for a bit of a sag halfway through it , " Match Point " is one Allen"s best films , a significant claim to make considering his involvement in the making of about as many movies as his age - an amazing accomplishment for Allen Konigsberg of Brooklyn , born on Dec. 1 , 1935."Match Point , " about the spectacular rise and " Crimes and Misdemeanors"-like un - fall of a young tennis pro ( Jonathan Rhys - Meyers , in a career - making performance ) , opens and closes with Caruso singing " Una furtiva lagrima , " it contains a virtually nonstop series of opera excerpts ,

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: and its long climactic scene is accompanied by the finale of Verdi"s " Otello .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: " Why the switch from jazz to opera ? " The story is operatic , " Allen has said .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: " It deals with the kinds of things that opera is so often about : love and lust , passion and jealousy , betrayal and tragedyand , of course , the confluence of fate and luck .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: " Always excelling in casting ( even in his many weaker films ) , Allen has outdone himself in " Match Point " - Scarlett Johansson , Emily Mortimer , Matthew Goode , Brian Cox , Penelope Wilton , and others all turn in topnotch performances , almost all playing characters that are different from previous movie ( if not stage ) roles .
person_name: Woody Allen, Scarlett Johansson, Emily Mortimer, Matthew Goode, Brian Cox, Penelope Wilton

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: Glory be : " Match Point " has no whining , no Woody - isms , it may be fully enjoyed by those who have developed a kind of allergy to Allen"s increasingly bothersome mannerisms over the years .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: Almost uniquely among his films , this has neither him nor a " Woody Allen character .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: " The tennis is so - so ,

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: but London ( a new venue for New York - bound Allen ) is marvelously real and alive .

title: Woody at 70: Opera and Tennis
review: All this and lots of Caruso - what a treat !

title: Knocked together
review: If this be nepotism , bring it on ! " Knocked Up " director Jeff Apatow gave his wife , Leslie Mann ,

title: Knocked together
review: and their two young daughters , Iris and Maude Apatow , important supportive roles , and the three pretty much walk away with the movie .
person_name: Leslie Mann, Iris Apatow, Maude Apatow

title: Knocked together
review: San Francisco native Mann plays Debbie , a prim - proper - and - funny control - freak wife , channeling an anachronistic presence from the " Fifties , the two kids are her spirited and uncontrolled children ; add a loving but unhappy husband ( Paul Rudd ) ,

title: Knocked together
review: and there you have the " model family " against which the unusual romance of Ben ( Seth Rogen ) and Alison ( Katherine Heigl ) takes place .

title: Knocked together
review: Ben is the most unlikely leading man of recent times , never mind a romantic lead : he is a penniless , unkempt , overweight young man with a kind of charm only drinking ( or pot - smoking ) buddies could appreciate .

title: Knocked together
review: Alison is gorgeous , successful , with the relentless sheen Heigl has been radiating with unvaried artificiality in 61 episodes ( so far ) of " Grey"s Anatomy " as Izzie Stevens .

title: Knocked together
review: So what do Ben and Alison have in common ? The pregnancy referred to in the movie"s indelicate title .

title: Knocked together
review: The unhappy embryo brings together not only the two unlikely lovers , but also their respective , far - distant tribes .

title: Knocked together
review: Ben"s grossly juvenile would - be webmaster playmates and Alison"s should - be proper family ( Debbie & Co. ) are squeezed together in a variety of ways .

title: Knocked together
review: Yes , it"s a non - starter basic plot ,

title: Knocked together
review: and the surprise is that the movie actually goes to some distance in search of some coherence .

title: Knocked together
review: Invariably linked with Apatow"s " 40 Year Old Virgin , " " Knocked Up " has mercifully less exaggerated physical comedy than the former ,

title: Knocked together
review: but the same sense of delight in the absurd , even if Apatow goes a long way at times to find it truthiness in the ludicrous .

title: Knocked together
review: A big plus : mostly appealing ( but realistic ) characters , easy to care about , with their faults and warts and all .

title: Knocked together
review: The result is rather pleasant : a mostly funny , occasionally charming , steadily foul - mouthed , frequently well - written , otherwise downright stupid comedy , enjoyable in spite of its unaccountably overblown length of over two hours .

title: Knocked together
review: It would have made a real good hour - long TV sitcom .

title: Knocked together
review: Also , " Knocked Up " has a first - class score by Joe Henry and Loudon Wainwright III .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: First and foremost , speaking as no fan of the genre , " The Bourne Ultimatum " is a breathtaking , virtuoso , superb action movie .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: Secondly , it is a silly malarky of cartoonish super - hero stuff .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: Thirdly , the film carries a complex , important point , about crime - fighters turning into criminals themselves .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: No reference is made to Abu Ghraib or the Executive Branch"s outrageous domestic assaults on constitutional rights , none is necessary .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: So , the latest in the " Bourne " series , in the hands of Paul Greengrass ( of the 2004 " Bourne Supremacy " and last year"s " United 93 " ) , is a significant achievement , perhaps held back but not actually diminished by the unavoidable excesses of the genre .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: "Breathtaking " above is meant both as a complimentary adjective

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: and a description of the physical sensation : for more than an hour from the first frame , the viewer seemingly holds his breath , pushed back against the chair by the force of relentless , globe - trotting , utterly suspenseful action .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: There is no letup , no variation in the rhythm and pull of the film ,

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: and yet it never becomes monotonous and tiresome the way some kindred music videos do after just a couple of minutes .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: Oliver Wood"s in - your - face cinematography is making the best of Tony Gilroy"s screenplay from Robert Ludlum"s 1990 novel ( which doesn"t stack up well against the " Bourne Identity , " written a decade earlier ) .
person_name: Oliver Wood, Tony Gilroy, Robert Ludlum

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: Matt Damon is once again the inevitable , irreplaceable Bourne , the deadliest of fantasy CIA agents , this time taking on the entire agency in search of his identity , his past , and the mysterious agency program that has turned him into a killing machine .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: Nothing like his quietly heroic Edward R. Murrow , the always - marvelous David Strathairn is the nasty top agency official , pitched against Bourne in trying to hide some illegal " take - no - prisoners " policies and brutal procedures .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: Joan Allen plays what appears to be the Good Cop against Strathairn"s Bad One .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: And , there is Julia Stiles as the agent once again coming to Bourne"s aid ; a combination of Greengrass " direction and Stiles acting results in a surprising impact by a mostly silent character , her lack of communication and blank expression more intriguing than miles of dialogue .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: So good is " The Bourne Ultimatum " that it gets away with the old one - man - against - the - world bit , this time stretched to ridiculous excesses , as Bourne defies constraints of geography , time , gravity ...

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: And physics in general .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: ( Can you fly backwards with a car from the top of a building ? Why not - it looks great .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: ) All this " real - world " magic - leaping from country to country in seconds , to arrive at some unknown location exactly as , when , and how needed - outdoes special - effect and superhero cartoon improbabilities .

title: Ultimate 'Bourne'
review: And yet , only a clueless pedant would allow " facts " interfere with the entertainment - based ecstasy of the Bourne fantasy .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: Norman Cousins would have loved the Coen Brothers " " Burn After Reading .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: " The late great Saturday Review editor had treated his illness with Marx Brothers movies , having " made the joyous discovery that 10 minutes of genuine belly laughter had an anesthetic effect and would give me at least two hours of pain - free sleep .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: "I have never felt healthier than after 96 minutes of explosive and grateful laughter at the " Burn " screening , also marveling at the array of British - stage caliber acting from " Fargo"-invoking Frances McDormand , witchy - icy Tilda Swinton , a more - manic - than - ever John Malkovich , and a dozen major players , such as J. K. Simmons as the deadpan CIA boss and Richard Jenkins as the former Greek Orthodox priest , now running an upscale gym .
person_name: Frances McDormand, Tilda Swinton, John Malkovich, J. K. Simmons, Richard Jenkins

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: Others may lead the cast list with George Clooney and Brad Pitt ,

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: but to me , their performances were just a bit on the self - conscious side , trying too hard .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: At any rate , it"s a great cast ,

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: and while the plot might have turned into a dud in somebody else"s treatment , the Coen Brothers " writing is hilarious , their zingers deadly .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: A critic , probably with bad digestion , has decried this " very black comedy set in a blanched , austere - looking Washington , D. C. An uninspiring and uncomfortable place in which everyone betrays everyone else ,

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: and the emotional tone veers from icy politeness to spitting rage and back again .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: " If I had a chance to think , instead of enjoying " Burn , " I would have contemplated Molière and Evelyn Waugh , their comedies of manners , psychological insight , and unbridled great humor .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: Yes , there are betrayals ( none better than the totally unexpected one at the end of the film ) ,

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: and there is rage , but all contained within a glorious bubble of writing - directing - acting excellence .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: " Burn " grips and holds , surprises and entertains , it is a virtuoso piece .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: Don"t be misled by the a " action - trailer " on TV , saturating the airwaves ; it says nothing of the film .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: Malkovich punching Pitt over a compromising CD of spook stuff is not at the heart of this - the McDormand character"s pursuit of cosmetic surgery is , what with her self - examination , a lengthy session with the surgeon ( Jeffrey DeMunn , in a brilliant turn ) , her desperate quest for a way to pay for it .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: Funny and going deep at the same time , " Burn " presents a series of character studies ( hence the thought of Molière ) , in the context of mannered yet true social interactions ( Waugh ) .

title: Tonight We Laugh
review: Skip descriptions of the plot , reject self - righteous denunciations of smart skepticism and charming evil , go and wallow in life - affirming laughter .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: Life , unlike bad movies , is seldom obvious .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: In life , murderous dictators don"t appear - especially at first - as mustache - twirling Snidley Whiplash figures , cackling madly ( although Mussolini came close ) .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: The scary truth about monsters is that they are three - dimensional beings , not cardboard cutouts , who just kill a lot of people , but otherwise put their pants on one leg at a time , like you and I ,

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: and that makes them so much scarier than if they came from another planet .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: In the best film of the " dictator genre , " Oliver Hirschbiegel"s brilliant " Downfall , " Hitler appears as a man who is kind to his dog and his secretary ( roughly in that order ) ,

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: and the impact of the work is all the greater as we witness what a " real person " is capable of doing .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: In Luis Puenzo"s " The Official Story , " Pinochet"s reign of terror is depicted through a single act of violence , as a door is slammed on Norma Aleandro"s hand ; the effect is stunning and " real .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: " In the hands of a less talented director , the story of Idi Amin would be told against mountains of skulls and bones left behind by Uganda"s mad ruler in the 1970s .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: ( His total toll is estimated at 300 , 000 .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: ) In Kevin Macdonald"s complex , intelligent , gripping " The Last King of Scotland , " more than half of the two - hour film subtly implies , hints at the dark forces underneath normalcy while " life goes on .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: " And so , having established real contact with the audience , a jolly and seductive Forest Whitaker then takes our breath away as the mask comes off ,

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: and his Amin reaches out from the screen for your throat .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: Macdonald - whose previous works are documentaries , including the Oscar - winning " One Day in September , " about the Munich Olympics terrorist incident - looks at Amin through the eyes of a young Scottish doctor ( James McAvoy ) , a well - meaning , honest humanitarian slowly seduced by the Scots - loving Amin , who appoints him his personal doctor and then adviser .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: The McAvoy character is fictional ( although Amin did have a Scottish doctor ) , coming from Giles Foden"s novel of the same name ,

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: but just about everything else in the film is based on fact - so much so that some documentary footage is smoothly integrated into the film .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: And yet , what"s important and outstanding about " Last King " is that just as a painting can surpass a photograph in presenting reality , this film conveys the seduction and horror of a brutal dictatorship indirectly , subtly , unexpectedly .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: Unexpected - and welcome - are the many flashes of humor , both Whitaker ( dictator with personality ) and McAvoy ( eager pup of a doctor with overactive hormones ) making the best of it .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: The tone is set in the opening sequence , as the frustrated , suppressed young Dr. Garrigan spins a small globe , swearing repeatedly that he will move to the first spot ( " the first ! " ) where he points when the globe stops .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: The first spot turns out to be Canada .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: McAvoy / Garrigan takes one look , hesitates ... And spins again .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: And so to Uganda ... The linear , freely - flowing story - telling is masterful , taking us from the small village where Dr. Garrigan comes to do good and ends up doing well through a chance meeting with Amin , to Kampala , much court intrigue and colorful depravity ( even as the fate of a nation is at stake ) ,

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: and eventually to Entebbe .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: Fun and games , authentic scenery ( the film was shot in Uganda ) , subtlety , psychology , a heart - pounding scene at Entebbe ( after the hijacking ,

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: but before the Israeli rescue ) , nudity , sex , violence , harrowing questions about " what would you do , " and all - " Last King " is a wonderful compendium of facts and greater truths .

title: Idi Amin, Entertainer
review: Also , a hell of a good movie .

title: What a Bargain!
review: These are the simple facts : " The Simpsons " is a TV series - with 400 episodes over 18 years - not on special cable , not at a premium . It"s free .

title: What a Bargain!
review: "The Simpsons Movie " requires paid attendance . It is not free .

title: What a Bargain!
review: Who would you think in all of Hollywood would handle a " situation " like this by making a clean breast of it .

title: What a Bargain!
review: Or even taunt the audience , foolish enough to pay for something available for free ?

title: What a Bargain!
review: But behold , it"s good old , dumb , obnoxious , lovable Homer Simpson himself , looking down from the movie screen , jabbing a finger at the audience and yelling : " SUCKERS ! " You can"t help sharing his delight , laughing at your own gullibility .

title: What a Bargain!
review: But are you really being taken advantage of ? Not by a long shot .
